ai.desc: Begins with a move pool of every move except Furioso. Can use any move in the move pool with equal probability, but once a move is used, it is removed from the move pool. Once the move pool is empty, will use Furioso and then reset the move pool. Durandal and Zelkova Workshop cannot be used right before Furioso.
ai.notes: Many of this creature's moves have additional effects depending on if it is currently the player's turn or the enemy's turn. Its second intent is a preview of its next move, which can be useful for planning ahead.

ai.desc: Begins with either Charge or Clean, then alternates between the two moves. In the 2 Helpers Act 1 elite encounter, the right Helper will always start with Charge, and the left Helper will always start with Clean.
ai.notes: Be careful about letting this enemy trigger Pattern Recognition after it uses Charge - the debuff cleanse will turn its Temp Strength into permanent Strength!

ai.desc: Uses Spring's Genesis every 3 turns. Otherwise, has equal chances of using Full Bloom or Magnificent End, but cannot use either move twice in a row.
ai.notes: The first Attack you play each turn will deal full damage for the rest of the combat, but all other Attacks are weakened. Make sure to play your strongest Attacks first each turn!

Begins with either Trembling Motion or Shaking Blow on the first turn, then always uses Shaking Blow from then on. In the 2 Crazed Employees Act 1 normal encounter, both will use Trembling Motion first. In the 3 Crazed Employees Act 1 normal encounter, the first two will use Trembling Motion first, and the last one will use Shaking Blow first. The first one's debuff will apply Weak, and the second one's debuff will apply Frail.

Cycles The First Movement -> The Second Movement -> The Third Movement -> The Fourth Movement -> Finale -> Curtain Call.
ai.notes: This boss supplies you with a lot of additional card draw - cards that gain energy, cards that combo with other cards, and low-cost cards are all more effective here. In addition, you can play the Performer Status cards the boss gives you to avoid their negative end-of-turn effects.

Has equal chances of rolling any move, but cannot roll the same move twice in a row.
ai.notes: It can be helpful to end the turn with the Expression power at 2 of 3 cards played. That way, playing 1 card next turn will change the intent, then you can play 2 more cards to react to the new intent and set up this tactic for the turn after that as well.

On the first intent, will use Ruthless Bullets every 3 turns. On other turns, has equal chances of using Inevitable Bullet or Silent Scope, but cannot use Silent Scope twice in a row. For the 2nd intent, will use Death Mark the turn before using Ruthless Bullets. Otherwise, uses Magic Bullet. The first intent will always target you, and the 2nd intent will target Nothing There unless it's dead, in which case it will target you as well. When the Seventh Bullet power has triggered for the turn or if the power is at 6/7 Attacks played, this creature will display Divinity particles.
ai.notes: Be careful about when you trigger the Seventh Bullet power - it will essentially double the amount of unblocked damage this creature deals for the turn. Triggering the power on the Mass Attack turn will result in a massive amount of damage done to Nothing There, but it can also do a lot of damage to you as well if you can't adequately block the Mass Attack. A lower risk but lower reward play would be to trigger the power when this creature is only attacking Nothing There with its second intent.

ai.desc: On the first intent, uses Dense Flesh first then alternates with Eye Contact. On the 2nd intent, uses Reaching Hand first then alternates with Evolve. The first intent will always target you, and the second intent will target Der Freischutz unless he's dead, in which case it will also target you.
ai.notes: You can manipulate this creature's Mimicry power to your advantage - play weak Attacks on this creature when it's attacking you to take less damage, and play strong Attacks on it when it's attacking the other enemy to make the other enemy take more damage!

ai.desc: Above 50% HP, will use Queen's Decree if both minions are dead. Otherwise, uses Predation. Once it drops to or below 50% HP, will use Ravenousness then use Predation every turn.
ai.notes: Bringing the minions to low HP without killing them so this creature consumes them can be a good way of maintaining Weak and Vulnerable debuffs on the boss.

If less than 3 Brothers have died, cycles Nauseating Reality -> Writhe -> Well-worn Parasol. If 3 or more Brothers have died, instead alternates between Shriek of Broken Dreams and Writhe.
ai.notes: Enraging the boss too early is generally a bad idea - take note of each Brother's passive and burst down the 2 Brothers that are most detrimental to you early on, then finish off the rest once you are ready to quickly end the fight.
